entry.title: Coinbase Introduces New Feature To Attract Millions Of Users To Web3, Here‚Äôs How
entry.summary:
Coinbase has announced the launch of a new feature that the largest exchange in the U.S. claims will attract millions of users to web3. The new product, ‚ÄúWallet as a Service‚Äù (WaaS), will allow businesses to build new web3 experiences with simplified wallet onboarding.
With the creation of WaaS, companies can integrate native wallets into their applications. Users with access to Web3 multi-party computation (MPC), cryptographic technology that allows users to create a ‚Äúkey‚Äù to be shared between the end customer and Coinbase.
Major companies focused on creating Dapps, developing frameworks, and delivering token-based experiences on the web3, such as Floor, Moonray, Thirdweb, and Tokenproof are currently building on Coinbase‚Äôs WaaS.
How Coinbase New Product Benefits Web3?
Coinb‚Ä¶

entry.title: Silvergate Bank Announces Voluntary Liquidation as Crypto Industry Woes Persist
entry.summary:
At 4:30 p.m. Eastern Time, Silvergate Bank announced its intention to wind down the crypto-friendly bank‚Äôs operations and voluntarily liquidate the company‚Äôs assets. The news follows significant financial troubles the bank faced, and the firm‚Äôs stock plummeted in value.
Details of Silvergate‚Äôs Wind Down and Liquidation Plan
Over the last six months, Silvergate Capital Corporation‚Äôs (NYSE: SI) stock dropped 94.82% against the U.S. dollar as the company faced significant financial troubles tied to its exposure to the now-defunct crypto exchange FTX. On Wednesday, March 8, 2023, the company announced it was winding down operations and plans to liquidate the bank. Four days ago, Silvergate discontinued the firm‚Äôs Silvergate Exchange Network payment platform.
‚ÄúIn light of recent industry ‚Ä¶

entry.title: BREAKING: Silvergate To Close Bank And Wind Down Operations
entry.summary:
Per several reports, crypto-friendly bank Silvergate will liquidate the financial institution and reduce its operations. The bank faced issues following the collapse of one of its major partners, crypto exchange FTX.
Today‚Äôs announcement seems like an unavoidable step after weeks of speculations and concerns from investors about Silvergate‚Äôs capacity to continue operating. As Bitcoinist reported, the bank‚Äôs shares suffered from a massive downtrend as the company reported a decline in liquidity and delayed its annual report.
Another Blow For The Industry, Silvergate Closes Its Doors
According to a Bloomberg report, Silvergate confirmed it would wind down operations due to recent events. The company issued the following statement:

entry.title: Neutronpay And BitcoinVN To Host Lightningcon Vietnam, Asia‚Äôs First Bitcoin And Lightning Conference
entry.summary:
In March, Bitcoin and Lightning builders and developers will congregate at a beachside resort in Da Nang, Vietnam. Asia‚Äôs first Bitcoin and Lightning Network conference will take place in Da Nang, Vietnam, March 22-24, 2023 at the beachside Furama Resort, according to a press release sent to Bitcoin Magazine.¬†
Hosts Neutronpay and BitcoinVN will organize the event in the town which some have dubbed ‚ÄúBitcoin Beach Vietnam.‚Äù The two companies, along with Nunchuk, are all Vietnam-based Bitcoin-only companies, and are excited to share what is happening in Asia as it relates to Bitcoin projects, Bitcoin communities and Lightning adoption across the region. Founder and CEO of Neutronpay Albert Buu, said of the decision that ‚ÄúWhen we looked around, we noticed that other parts of the world were b‚Ä¶

entry.title: Ethereum Co-Founder Vitalik Buterin‚Äôs Address Sells Trillions of Airdropped Tokens, Causes Illiquid Coin Prices to Plummet
entry.summary:
On March 7, onchain observers noticed that Vitalik Buterin, the co-founder of Ethereum, had allegedly sold billions and trillions of airdropped ERC20 tokens, resulting in a gain of an estimated $700,000 in value. The market liquidity of the airdropped tokens was shallow, and the relatively unknown ERC20 tokens plummeted in value after Buterin reportedly sold the funds.
Crypto Speculators Question Motives Behind Vitalik Buterin‚Äôs Airdropped Token Sell-Off
According to a record of token transfers associated with an address labeled ‚ÄúVB,‚Äù Vitalik Buterin, the co-founder of Ethereum, appears to have sold a significant amount of ERC20 tokens that were airdropped to his address. Blockchain explorer statistics show that the address associated with Buterin sold billions of cult dao (CULT) token‚Ä¶

entry.title: Bitcoin Leverage Ratio Rises, Volatile Move Incoming?
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows the Bitcoin estimated leverage ratio has risen recently, a sign that a volatile move may be coming soon for the asset.
Bitcoin Estimated Leverage Ratio Has Observed A Surge
As an analyst in a CryptoQuant post pointed out, the open interest has also shown a small increase in the last few hours. The ‚Äúopen interest‚Äù here is an indicator that measures the total amount of contracts that are currently open on the Bitcoin futures market. The metric accounts for both short and long contracts.
Another relevant metric is the ‚Äúestimated leverage ratio,‚Äù which measures the ratio between the open interest and the total amount of BTC currently sitting on derivative exchanges. This indicator tells us how much leverage future market users are taking on average.
When the ratio h‚Ä¶

Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell has warned that ‚Äúthe ultimate level of interest rates is likely to be higher than previously anticipated.‚Äù In addition, if faster tightening is warranted, the Fed ‚Äúwould be prepared to increase the pace of rate hikes,‚Äù Powell said.
The Fed Anticipates Higher Rates, Faster Hikes
Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell presented the Fed‚Äôs semiannual Monetary Policy Report to the Senate Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs on Tuesday and the House Committee on Financial Services on Wednesday.
‚ÄúMy colleagues and I are acutely aware that high inflation is causing significant hardship, and we are strongly committed to returning inflation to our 2% goal,‚Äù Powell said in his identical remarks to both the Senate and House committees. He detail‚Ä¶

entry.title: Gemini Loses JP Morgan As Banking Partner
entry.summary:
According to a report from CoinDesk, crypto exchange Gemini lost a major partner, banking Giant JP Morgan. The report cites a person familiar with the matter, which failed to provide further details about the decision.
In the past years, as the price of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies trends to the downside, several companies and projects went belly up and filed for bankruptcy protection. Gemini has seen its fair share of scandals.
Gemini‚Äôs Rocky Months Lead To JP Morgan Break Up?
As Bitcoinist reported, Gemini has been scrutinized by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). The crypto exchange was charged with offering an unregistered security via its defunct ‚ÄúEarn Program.‚Äù
This investigation and the events around Gemini Earn might have led to JP Morgan‚Äôs decision‚Ä¶

entry.title: Baseball Fans Can Now Instantly Receive Bitcoin After Perth Heat‚Äôs Most Exciting Plays
entry.summary: A new Lightning partnership will let Perth Heat fans scan QR codes after stolen bases and home runs, rewarding them with bitcoin instantly. The Perth Heat, the Australian Baseball League‚Äôs most successful baseball team, has announced a new partnership that rewards fans in bitcoin every time a player from Perth Heat steals a base or hits a home run. The partnership with Bitrefill, Wallet of Satoshi and IBEX will allow fans to ‚ÄúSteal Sats‚Äù by scanning a QR code displayed on the game stream or on the team's social media channels when a player makes an impressive play. Fans will receive their reward instantly after scanning the code with a Lightning-enabled wallet, introducing a novel fan interaction system that brings further excitement to thrilling moments in games. "We are thrilled to be l‚Ä¶

entry.title: India To Include Money Laundering Provisions On Crypto Sector
entry.summary:
According to a report from Reuters, the government of India has decided to introduce money laundering provisions in the crypto sector. The Finance Ministry released a notice on Tuesday stating that the anti-money laundering legislation shall be applied to crypto trading, safekeeping, and other financial services.
The notification released by the government lacked details. Still, the Prevention of Money Laundering Act mandated that financial institutions should maintain records of all transactions in the past ten years.
The financial institution must provide these records to the regulators if needed. These records must be verified, and the financial institutions must identify all the clients.
This marks India‚Äôs most recent step towards ensuring a strict oversight of digital assets.¬†‚Ä¶

entry.title: India-Russia Oil Deals Chip Away at Dollar Dominance in International Trade
entry.summary:
On Wednesday, Reuters reported that Western sanctions on Russia and oil trading between Moscow and India have started to erode the dollar‚Äôs decades-old dominance of international oil trade. The oil deals between India and Russia have been settled in other currencies, putting the U.S. dollar‚Äôs dominance in the oil trade under pressure.
Sources Say Non-U.S. Currencies Used in India-Russia Oil Deals Total ‚ÄòSeveral Hundred Million Dollars‚Äô
During the last few months, Bitcoin.com News has reported on several instances in which analysts and economists suggest that Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa, collectively known as BRICS nations, are attempting to undermine the U.S. dollar. On March 8, Reuters columnists Nidhi Verma and Noah Browning reported on how India‚Äôs oil deals with R‚Ä¶

He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in ‚ÄúSnow Crash,‚Äù goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. entry.summary: As meme coin promoter Musk turns his attention from crypto to AI, Dogecoin appears to bearing the brunt of this week's losses.

entry.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'
entry.summary: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.

entry.title: Demand for Blockchain Devs Is Soaring‚ÄîBut Not Just in Crypto
entry.summary: Despite recent crypto layoffs, prospects for blockchain developers may be set to hold strong according to some in the hiring industry.

entry.title: Babel Finance Mulls New Token Launch to Repay Creditors
entry.summary: Embattled crypto broker Babel Finance is exploring the launch of a new DeFi token to resolve the company‚Äôs financial woes.

entry.title: Critic Says Yuga Labs Bitcoin NFTs Auction Sets 'Really Bad Precedent‚Äô
entry.summary: Yuga Labs' Bitcoin-based NFT offering implements a primitive auction technique to launch the TwelveFold NFT collection.

entry.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast
entry.summary: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Wants to Watch Netflix and Read Crypto News While Awaiting Trial
entry.summary: The U.S. Attorney submitted a new request to limit the websites and online services Sam Bankman-Fried can use.

entry.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace
entry.summary: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."

entry.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini
entry.summary: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."

entry.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'
entry.summary: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.

entry.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria
entry.summary: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."

entry.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next
entry.summary: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next‚Äîincluding token-gated sneaker drops.

entry.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs
entry.summary: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.

entry.title: NFT Factory President: 'NFTs Will Be Active in a Bull or Bear Market'
entry.summary: John Karp, president of NFT Factory Paris and the founder of Non-Fungible Conference Lisbon, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the exploding Web3 community in Paris, the concept behind creating a physical gallery for NFTs, and how the existing art community understands NFTs because "everybody understands art."

entry.title: What Attracted Artist Tom Sachs to NFTs? Community and Identity
entry.summary: Tom Sachs is a conceptual artist whose work has been displayed in museums and galleries all over the world, but he told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris he never before felt part of an art movement‚Äîuntil he got into NFTs and Web3. He talked about Rocket Factory and the pull of Web3 art communities.

entry.title: Arianee CEO: Big Consumer Brands Are Going to Take Web3 to 1 Billion Users
entry.summary: Pierre-Nicolas Hurstel, CEO of Arianee, which offers enterprise software to consumer brands to help them launch NFTs tied to physical goods, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how much the NFT space is growing despite the bear market, how big consumer brands will take crypto mainstream, and how loyalty programs are going to be the next huge use case for NFTs.

entry.title: Salesforce Web3 Lead: Every Brand's Web Site Will Support Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: Salesforce's Web3 lead Marc Mathieu sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about the CRM giant's crypto strategy, why "we had to" embrace Web3, and why the crypto wallet is "the new cookie" online.

entry.title: Doodles CEO: Why In-Person Meetups Are Crucial for NFT Communities
entry.summary: Doodles CEO Julian Holguin, former president of Billboard, sat down with Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris to talk about the strong vibes at the event and the importance of IRL meetups in Web3, what's next for Doodles and the community, and his prediction that many newer projects won't survive the crypto winter.
